segments.text: I can't take my eyes off that precarious stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really stretching for those cookies, fully extended.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His weight seems to be pulling the stool backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The legs are splayed unnaturally, almost like it's about to collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I keep thinking it's going to tip over any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He could fall right onto the wet floor, or hit the counter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That would be a terrible accident, imagine the loud crash.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so close, yet so far from noticing this danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's making me anxious just watching him up there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't anyone telling him to be careful, or helping him?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The poor boy doesn't even realize the risk he's taking for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This situation is an accident waiting to happen, a complete recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost see him losing his balance and tumbling down.
segments.speaker: PAR
